name: Intelline
headline: We make generators that use 40% less fuel, with any fuel.
description:
Intelline makes industrial power generators that use 40% less fuel. Our first customers are energy sector and alternative fuel production companies. Replacing a 1MW diesel generator with a 1MW Intelline MLG system can save up to $1,000,000/year in fuel costs alone.

There are 200,000 new industrial generators produced per year, and at $85k for the average generator size this is a $17B market opportunity.

Our generator can efficiently run emerging fuel types that traditional diesel engines can't use (flare gas, syngas, ammonia, hydrogen), and can switch between fossil fuels and any other liquid/gaseous fuel while running.

# Driving the Transition to Sustainable Fuels
Modular Carbon-Neutral Industrial Engines
![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_0caf79bfd6fd4bc98c50779043523152~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_883,h_592,al_c,q_90,enc_avif,quality_auto/05193e_0caf79bfd6fd4bc98c50779043523152~mv2.png)
## VISION
One engine.
Any fuel.
No compromise.
While traditional diesel engines have helped power the industrial world for over a century, our Modular Linear Generator (MLG) is designed to address modern challenges, and become the industrial power source of choice for the next century.
## FEATURES
The MLG system serves a wide range of industrial applications.
### UP TO 40% LOWER FUEL CONSUMPTION
CAVIE™ modules are the heart of the modular linear generator. Conventional engine technology has a limited ability to adapt to changing conditions and loading demands; therefore, efficiency in real world use suffers. CAVIE™ modules can adjust key physical parameters of the generator (displacement, compression, valve lift and timing, fuel injection) to maintain high combustion efficiency across a wide range of loading.
[Read More](https://www.intelline.ca/<https:/www.intelline.ca/technology>)
![HQImages010922.jpf](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_5fb4ecf8c80a49a28834327c90284897~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_123,h_69,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/05193e_5fb4ecf8c80a49a28834327c90284897~mv2.jpg)
![HQImages010922_0700.jpf](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_ca8b34fdf2424e56a85dad1fb2458038~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_108,h_61,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/HQImages010922_0700_jpf.jpg)
![HQImages010922_1320.jpf](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_cae4c823d3bc4d81bd7431880fa03b2e~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_108,h_61,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/HQImages010922_1320_jpf.jpg)
### RUN ZERO-CARBON FUEL AT ANY TIME
The ability to adjust displacement and compression allows multi-fuel equipped systems to switch fuel types at any time. Modules can switch from fossil fuels to biofuel, synthetic fuel, or even hydrogen without changing the hardware. The CAVIE™ architecture makes it easy to retrofit new fuel systems in the future as well.
[Read More](https://www.intelline.ca/<https:/www.intelline.ca/technology>)
### STACKABLE TO 2MW POWER OUTPUT
CAVIE™ modules are designed for up to 50kW output from a single module and can be stacked together in a single enclosure for higher power outputs, up to 2MW. Multiple CAVIE™ modules offer even greater load matching capability as individual modules can deactivate completely when not needed.
[Read More](https://www.intelline.ca/<https:/www.intelline.ca/technology>)
![HQImages010922_2000.jpf](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_0ea87cc334a949d7b0e24f6b12cf6031~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_123,h_69,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/05193e_0ea87cc334a949d7b0e24f6b12cf6031~mv2.jpg)
![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_0b14baaa4c21499f80b6b408c79921a5~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_147,h_110,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/05193e_0b14baaa4c21499f80b6b408c79921a5~mv2.jpg)
## WHY INTELLINE
The lowest risk for the future of industrial power.
Battery electric and fuel cell solutions depend on dedicated infrastructure to be a viable industrial power source. Our fuel agnostic generators reduce overhead and emissions with existing fossil fuel supply chains. With MLG systems, customers can explore new renewable fuel sources at any time without fear of new supply chain consistency.
![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_26873447f0dc46c5b174a913691615dd~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_123,h_75,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/05193e_26873447f0dc46c5b174a913691615dd~mv2.jpg)
## Fuel Savings Estimator
12h
HOURS OF USE
$284,279
ANNUAL FUEL SAVINGS*
1,000kW
GENERATOR POWER
1,023t
CO2 EMISSIONS SAVINGS
*Fuel consumption compared with average modern diesel generators operating at 100% Load, 365 days per year. Diesel price per liter used = 1.351 USD/L. Additional savings from active load matching features not included in calculation. Actual savings may vary.
## CAREERS
We’re looking for innovative talent to join our team. See all positions and submit your CV.
[Openings](https://www.intelline.ca/<https:/www.intelline.ca/careers>)
![intelline_logo.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/05193e_fefca7c0f3274380bf6494c6496eed47~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_154,h_60,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_3,enc_avif,quality_auto/intelline_logo.png)

generated_description:
### Intelline: Revolutionizing Industrial Power Generation

**Company Overview:**
Founded in 2017 and part of Y Combinator’s Batch W19, Intelline is a Canadian startup located in Waterloo, Ontario, that’s developing a new kind of industrial power generator. With a compact team of three, they’re tackling a significant market opportunity in the industrial generator sector, valued at around $17 billion with 200,000 new units produced annually, each averaging $85,000.

**Mission:**
Intelline’s mission is straightforward yet impactful: "We make generators that use 40% less fuel, with any fuel." The goal is to transform how industries power themselves by creating more efficient systems.

**Technology:**
At the heart of Intelline's innovation is their Modular Linear Generator (MLG). This advanced system is capable of adapting to a variety of fuel types, including alternatives that traditional diesel engines can’t handle—flare gas, syngas, ammonia, and hydrogen. This means that businesses can switch between different fuel sources seamlessly, mitigating long-term fuel supply risks and reducing carbon emissions.

**Innovation Highlights:**
- **Fuel Efficiency:** The MLG can lower fuel consumption by up to 40% compared to modern diesel generators. This translates to significant savings; replacing a 1MW diesel generator with an Intelline MLG could save a company up to $1 million annually in fuel costs.
- **Multi-Fuel Compatibility:** Thanks to its CAVIE™ modules, the generator can switch fuel types on the fly, making it more adaptable and future-ready than traditional generators.
- **Scalable Power Output:** With a modular design, the system can be stacked up to 2MW in power, allowing users to tailor their energy needs without overcommitting to a fixed power solution.

**Market Position and Vision:**
Intelline is not just another player in the energy market; they're positioned as a sustainable alternative to traditional diesel options, aligning with the push for greener technologies. Their promise of reliability—being able to run on both fossil fuels and emerging clean energy sources—offers businesses the flexibility to transition without a complete overhaul of their systems.

**Why Choose Intelline?**
In a landscape where many companies are depending on battery or fuel cell technology—often limited by infrastructure—Intelline's generators stand out as low-risk, versatile solutions. They empower companies to implement sustainable practices without the fear of inconsistent supply chains that could disrupt operations.

**Get Involved:**
Intelline is on the lookout for innovative minds to join their small yet impactful team. Interested applicants can visit their careers page to see available positions.

For more information, check out their website at [Intelline](https://www.intelline.ca).

In summary, Intelline is paving the way for a new era of industrial power—efficient, adaptable, and ready for the future. If they succeed, they won't just change how we generate power; they'll redefine what we think is possible in the energy sector.
